content: spirals and helices by craftykitties this is an easy hat using helices and a conical spiral and is a great way to have fun with colors without worrying about jogs in your lines each color is a separate helix that starts at the bottom and goes around and around until you bind off i used 4 colors but the concept works with 3 4 5 or more colors just make sure the number of co stitches is divisible by the number of colors you are using drop the yarn at the end of a color segment and pick up the waiting yarn do not twist the yarn try reusing a color twice as shown in the brown sample the only challenge is keeping the yarn from tangling i find that putting the 4 balls of yarn in a bowl and rotating the bowl every 5 row or so does the trick nicely size fits adult head 22 materials needles size 3 25mm and 4mm 16 circular needles 4mm double pointed needles stitch marker tapestry needle yarn multiple colors of your favorite dk or worsted weight yarn adjust co accordingly abbreviations co cast on k knit p purl k2tog knit 2 together pm place marker sm slip marker pattern co 96 on 3 25mm circular needles blue rib -
